subject: Re: [junit] Re: exiting of the execution after the test runner is completed
msgSnippet: Please write more carefully. It wasn t clear which part of your message was actually your writing and which was J.B s answer. See
messageBody:
Please write more carefully.
It wasn't clear which part of your message was actually your writing and
which was J.B's answer.
See http://www.kassj.com/netiquette/netiquette.html#5

On Thursday 16 September 2004 23:55, brains_reddy wrote:
> Here is a sample code for what i am saying,
> public static void main(String[] args)
> {
> junit.textui.Testrunner.run(TestName.class);
> Finally{
> conn.close();
> }
> }

The compiler should reject code as above. Please provide at least
compilable examples. The Java keyword is finally, not Finally, and it
goes after a try block. The JUnit class is TestRunner, not Testrunner.
Again, please take more care.

The following minimum example works at my place, so I'd suggest you first
make your code compile, then reduce it to a minimum example that shows
the problem, and then post that minimum code sample.

Robert


--- cut here ---

import junit.framework.*;

public class SomeTest extends TestCase {
public static void main(String args[]) {
try {
junit.textui.TestRunner.run(SomeTest.class);
}
finally {
System.out.println("Cleaning up");
}
}

public SomeTest(String name) {
super(name);
}

public void testSomething() {
System.out.println("Some test");
}
}


Output:

[robert@tiamat ~]$ javac -classpath /usr/java/junit/junit.jar:. \
SomeTest.java
[robert@tiamat ~]$ java -classpath /usr/java/junit/junit.jar:. SomeTest
.Some test

Time: 0.009

OK (1 test)

Cleaning up
[robert@tiamat ~]$
